They took off our drink off our bill which was nice, but to be completely honest should of taken off something a little more expensive, especially for the fact our food was at room temperature by the time we actually got to eat.
I have had the pleasure of eating here a few times.  The food is good.  The service is excellent.  Great spot to have a drink before the club.
Our food was incredible- hands down best meal we had in Vegas! The service was phenomenal. I definitely recommend having scallops added to the steak- the perfect surf and turf combo!

We only sampled the appetizers here unfortunately so I don't know how they compare to the main dishes. However, between my party of 8 we ordered 2 of each; Lobster tacos, Kobe sliders, Yellowtail sashimi, kobe chili cheese fries, wings, and the adult mac & cheese. 
In the end it seemed a bit over priced for fancied junk food in an atmosphere that was a bit too loud. And be forewarned that the mac & cheese is not for the weak!

Nice to dine here if you fit any or all descriptions below:

1) high roller, w/one, or pretend to be one. 
2) you care more ab/look & pretension than scale of food.
3) you're w/a group of pals who insist trying it for special occasion like BDay.

I fell in the 3rd category. 

Food was not bad yet strangely not memorable. The bill certainly was since it looked like an absurd over estimation even though we had a big group. Thank goodness a gf split an order w/me in advance. 

Not kid friendly--too dim. Service is rather cool though.

Fix in their name should mean something needs to be fixed.

This is a hard review because there were elements I really loved. First of all, I was served the finest scallop dish I have ever had. The heavenly combination of scallops and crab sauce over tiny potato pancakes was perfection. Very rich but clean and fresh tasting.

My dinner companion had a lovely veal chop and lobster mashed potatoes. She loved her dinner and said it was very filling.
She sampled a few wines before settling on a Jordan Cabernet. She loved that, too.

We shared the banana doughnuts with insipid dipping sauce. This was a rancid tasting, stomach clenching mistake. 
Even though much of it was left, no one really seemed to care.
This wasn't the worst part of the evening...

After we were seated, a couple sat down at the next table. They had clearly been fighting for a while and the food and wine didn't help things. It was beyond awkward. At one point, the man placed himself between our two tables and continued the argument that was both personal and pornographic. It was awful and didn't let up until he got up and left.

It was very disturbing. I have a bit of claustrophobia and as I had no clear path out and my breathing space impaired, I started to feel lightheaded.

The manager should have been sensitive to the situation and either moved them or us. All I could think of was how to breathe with all of this going on. The throbbing and ultra loud music didn't help matters.

We thought this would be the finest meal at the Bellagio but it was a terrible experience.

Need to justify costs / not that great - Understanding that it is in one of the most expensive Vegas casinos still....

Decor / Ambiance - very nice. The wood ceiling design is very cool. 

Service - very good

Food - 2 8 oz filets ($48 ea) cooked perfectly but have a heavy smoke flavor of mesquite. Not the flavor profile I look for in a $48 piece if meat. Let it speak for itself....it will with flavor, juiciness etc. It's not a BBQ restaurant and mine don't taste that smokey. This was VERY disappointing for us. We've been to Ruth's Chris, Flemings, Morton's, Maestros etc. Steak like this is not supposed to have a smoke flavor this heavy. 
Truffle pasta was great with prosciutto  and peas but was $37. Very pricey for this dish. Even $27 would have been too much. 
Sides - smoked mashed potatoes were to whipped for my liking and were served in small taurine ($12). Mac and cheese ($15)bites were good. Basically like 4 fish sticks only better. They were good, but not great. Creamed corn with a touch of jalapeño was the best. It was very good but again in a small taurine. We wanted more for $12! No bread offered to the table either. Bummer. 

Drinks - pineapple mojito ($20)!!
Jack Daniels and 7 UP ($14) each
Robert Hall Syrah was great for $52.00. 

Over all - nice place inside Bellagio but just a tad pricey with small portions.

Bottom Line - I'm out and wont be returning to FIX. There are much better places that have better food with better prices including appetizers.

Good tiny burgers. Good spicy tuna. 
Excessively expensive. Service ok. Loud. Smells like casino.

This restaurant was recommended by the Conceirge in Mandalay and we were looking for a cool place to grab a bite not too upscale. This was it, tucked inside the Bellagio, right on the casino floor, there was this hip trendy place. 

The one thing I notice it was not too secluded and could get quite loud from the floor of the casino since there was no wall and it was very dark inside. Still, the menu boasts some unique tastefully done dishes and some delicious cocktails. The service was friendly and the price was okay, not the best for the food you get. Scallops were delicious but the fried mac and cheese was the best! Pizza was sub par not great. In all not a bad meal. Not sure I would make this my first choice in Vegas though.

On saturday august 15th at 945 pm my sister and i decided to wait at the bar to have a cocktail while we wait for our table and the rest of our party to arrive. The bar was half full and there were 2 bar tenders working 1 female and 1 male. It was clear to see the male bartender was taking care of the servers and the guests at his end of the bar. We waited patiently for the bar tender to greet us or even ask us what we wanted to drink. 10 minutes go by nothing not even a glance at us or eye contact. We both took turns going to the ladies room and now 20 minutes go by still nothing. The bar is not packed by all means and there are at least 3-4 empty seats. Im beginning to wonder if we were invisible , if she was just plain tunnel visioned, if she was in training, or if she was prejudging us because we were not white.  The rest of our party is now arriving and still no drink. Being a bartender and beverage server in las vegas myself i start to get upset at this horrible service.  30 minutes now and just as i decide i had enough of being treated like were invisible. Our table is ready and we get seated. The dinner was average, and the waitress and bussers were very attentive. I am very big on service and come from over 15 years in the customer service industry. So the bar staff gets an overall F! The wait staff an A and its because of them i didnt rate this place with a 1 star. The hosts a B. My overall experience of my first visit to fix after hearing such great things was to say the very least is im not impressed.

It was a dessert night for us, and I'm so pleased we went to FIX! The service was amazing. We tried the Espresso Martini... I was in love with the first sip. Then, the variety of desserts were just incredible. The S'mores, banana filled donuts with peanut butter dipping sauce, the cookie crème brûlée, and the ice cream pops... All so amazing!! Can't wait to go back for dinner!
Everything was amazing, from the meal to the drinks to the desert. A group of five of us got food ranging from burger sliders to the sea bass risotto and everything was melt in your mouth fantastic.
Had an amazing meal again at FIX. Started off with the lobster tacos then the Seabass. I keep trying to try other things on the menu but I keep ordering the same. Can't wait to go back.
still no resolution from Bellagio on rectifying the horrible experience we had. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY THERE OR AT THE FIX.

It's not a bad place to do some people watching, but you'd better drink beforehand.  I'm ok paying up for cocktails at some places, but not here.  It was a little expensive for my taste.  We also ordered sliders cooked medium, which ended up very well done, although the spicy tuna was ok.  Even though we were still hungry, we opted to go elsewhere to get more food and drinks.

I would never go here on my own, but the birthday girl's bf treated us all out. Insaneee!! Any way, our party of 12 was quickly seated and handed menus. First thought after perusing the items and prices...uhhhhh can I just stick with my water? hahaha

I ended up ordering the Bobby Baldwin Burgers which came with 3 sliders, a cone of seasoned fries, and ketchup in a little jar. Presentation was adorable. Taste was a bit average for restaurant style burgers. I got to taste the lobster tacos and kobe chili cheese fries. These were the stars that night and I probably could've gotten full off these apps alone. Lobster tacos were interesting, I wasn't expecting to taste anything cold, and the thin shell made it easy to bite into. The chili cheese fries were BOMB!! Presentation again was cute, a stack of fries, hot bowl of cooked chili, and mini pitcher of cheese sauce. I def would recommend this to start off with, but it might outshine your entree. I tried some of the meaty entrees like rib eye (med rare), thought it was too bloody for my taste. Tasted ok, but I'm not really a steak kind of girl. 

Service was friendly, woman's bathroom was clean (there was a male worker waiting right outside the doors...made me feel a little uneasy), decor was fancy. I left Fix feeling stuffed and tired. All in all, an excellent experience.

This is another cafe which looks hip and classy but offers mediocre food. Our waiter suggested the crab cake popovers and we picked the bite sized chicken wings. Popovers breading was heavy. The wings with blue cheese dip was lip smacking delicious and very unique. Entree was pork shank with mushroom risotto! Perfectly cooked and fell off the bone. Risotto was just about ok. Cocktails at $20 is overrated! Why come back here when you have so many fabulous options on the strip!

Ate here on March 8 2015. 

I ordered the bobby Baldwin sliders and the lobster taco. 

Service: The service was decent and nothing to rave or complain about. However , since I was driving all day and haven't eaten a thing, i asked the waitress if there was some bread or anything to get my blood sugar up. She directed me to ordering an appetizer lol. 

The food : the lobster tacos came in 4 tacos , each was about the length of 2.5 quarters long. That is pushing the miniature trend a bit, don't you think ? And on top of that it was about 25 bucks. It was a pretty bad deal for mediocre food. I dont understand why people rave about it. It wasn't freshly prepared as well. It seemed like it has been sitting in a refrigerator in some tub and they just scooped it in the taco shell. 

The sliders wernt bad , but again I dont understand why people are raving about it. It was your average sliders, perhaps with better grade meat. 30 dollars ish. 

Price: i have to say that their price point and the food that i experienced has a huge disconnect. The food is pretty average and standard but they are charging a premium. I get it if you have a view of the bellagio fountains , or if their food was spectacular , but neither is true. I happily shelled out $$$$ at prime , yellowtail , and olives because of the view but maybe im missing something at fix. 

Overall: I think for the aggressive price point and the caliber of food you're getting , there's better options in bellagio and certainly better ones in other casinos.
Had a nice late dinner at this place. The lobster tacos were light and fresh. The drinks were quite tasty. I had the Cotton Candy Martini. Sweet but not overly so.
The Roasted Beef Steak tomato and the Spicy Tuna were amazing.  Heather and Cisco are great at the bar.

My girl friends and I were staying at Bellagio and agreed to have a comped dinner at FIX before going to our Bottle Service Reservations at The Bank Nightclub later that night, all provided by our wonderful Light Group VIP Host. It was a nice atmosphere and a perfect stop before a long night out. The steak tasted better than most of the other upscale steakhouses I've been to. My girl friends all agreed that the food was absolutely delicious and service was great. We will definitely be back again!
Great food and ambiance. Had filet mignon and lobster. Wine - min $50 so a bit pricey.

Slick, lounge style dining in the middle of the bellagio. It's dark, the music is loud, the food is outrageously expensive, Vegas baby!  A pretty creative menu all things considered. U gotta try the hot wing lollipops and scallops. Everything we had illicited rave reviews. Definitely a place for a group on the town...

I wanted to like them.  But on several levels they just seemed to miss the mark.  The female staff was clearly hired because they're easy on the eyes, but some of those girls were dumber than a box a cheap plastic fake hair at the Korean beauty supply shop.  Considering the prices, the service was not up to par.  I've gotten better service at places where the entrees were a third of the price.  

Also, the lighting is dark.  Is it weird that I like to see my food?  I had food here with a friend, then others in our group met us for drinks.  Sadly even though we told the host we were expecting others our friends still had problems communicating that to the host and finding us.

My recommendation - this is a places to head for lounging more than munching.  It was easy to actually have a conversation and hang out.
Try the cucumber martini, adult Mac n cheese, and the scallops Benedict and I promise you won't be disappointed!

Fix is a nice, trendy, and fairly loud restaurant.  The lobster tacos were superb. I could have eaten 8 of them. There are three to an order. The shells were crispy and lobster bouncy (fresh). The veal chop was the best I've ever had. It was very tender and the red wine reduction sauce had a nice bite to it. The mushrooms on top of the veal added nice flavoring as well.  I didn't enjoy the side of mushrooms (part of side section on menu) though; they were too buttery for my taste.

Consistently, amaazing food and service!  Been going here for 7+ years and they have NEVER disappointed.  Can't say enough.  The truffle pasta my friends love.  OH THOSE DONUTS! YUM!  Can't say enough about their chicken wings + fries.  It's like bar food on steroids.  SO GOOD!  Super professional host/ waiters/bussers.  Really love this place!

I just had the best time at Fix!!!!!  The food was fantastic and the service was amazing.  Our waiter Roberto even went out of his way to make sure that I didn't miss out on the miso glazed short ribs (I was torn between 2 dishes)and he brought me one short rib on the side-compliments of the chef.  I will be back asap!!!!

We dropped in for a drink and couple of appetizers, and weren't very impressed. I felt as if we had walked into a full blown club, and not a restaurant.

I was hoping for some good drinks, but to my disappointment, the drinks were subpar, how can you be a bartender in Vegas and NOT know how to make a drink?

The food was pretty much the best part, though we only ordered some appetizers to snack on before our eight hour alcohol binge. 

Service was inadequate, I just felt like the experience should've been so much more than it was.

My friend and I had dinner here the other night and it was truly excellent. The service was awesome and the food was great.

Food: This place is known as a steak house with an emphasis for late night dining. Since I don't eat steak, I had the lobster entree with a side of creme spinach. The lobster was very good and included a small portion of vegetables. The spinach was excellent. Creamy, not too salty, and fresh. The lobster was very juicy and delicious. I loved it even though I am normally not a huge seafood girl. For an upscale bar restaurant, the portions were pretty good. 

Ambiance: It's very nice and even though there was music playing the entire time, I could hear myself while I was talking. It had a classy modern look with black trimmings. It was a bit dim and attractive yet subtle enough to fit into the theme of the casino. My friend and I had walked passed it without seeing it the first time around.

Location: Since it's right next to the Bank (lounge/club) at the Bellagio, I will agree with others that you can def. people watch. There will be barely clad women and well dressed men walking pass the restaurant or pre-partying and eating there before moving on next door. Since we went there for a very late dinner (around midnight), the club next door (the bank) also had a couple promoters standing near the restaurant handing out the VIP/free admission tickets for ladies. 

Service: The service was truly 5 stars here. Both of the guys that served our table were totally genuine, downright awesome, and 1 was originally from the Bay Area (irrelevant but yay!). They were very attentive and checked on us multiple times. When I wanted to use the bathroom, one of them even showed me where it was and walked me to it. 

Bathroom: Very clean bathroom! Single stall - 1 female, 1 male though technically it can just be 2 unisex bathrooms. There's a lady that attends to the bathroom (both male and female) and she goes in and wipes/cleans the bathrooms quite frequently. 

Payment: Takes credit card and you can charge it to your room like most places in Vegas if you happen to be staying at Bellagio or one of the other properties owned by the MGM Mirage group.

It opens late night and serves dinner until 1am. They never rushed us and provided great service. We sat around chatting for awhile and was never asked to leave.

Great center strip location and service.
It was a fairly decent.  Didn't get around to the 90.00$ steak plater but I leave that for next had a simple breakfast and kept it moving

I would say stick to the steaks.  They looked good.   I had the sea bass, which was not as favorable as I have in other restaurants of this price level.  Flavor was underwhelming. 

The mac and cheese sticks were amazing...highly recommend them.   

Overall, for the high price you pay here, I would rather be across the casino with at least a great view of the fountains.

As good as it can get. The atmosphere of the restaurant is hip and modern. The service is pretty good. Your table gets assigned a group of servers and they all coordinate to provide good service. However, their food was just amazing. Their speciality is steak. I ordered the kobe steak and it was delicious. The steak was perfectly cooked, juicy and full of flavor. This dish comes with mashed potatoes which were also pretty good. I wished there was more potato as the dish needed a larger side. For our appetizer we ordered some tuna which was fresh and delicious. Both items were very good but also small. This is definitely a great restaurant if you are craving a good quality steak.
The food was decent. The calamari was pretty good and the various french fries were interesting. The service was average. Nothing particular was great or horrible about the dining experience.

Great dining experience at the Bellagio! Sure it's overpriced but the food was excellently prepared and our waiter, Michael Cedroni went the extra mile to make sure we were well taken care of throughout the meal. Great start to a memorable evening!

Wow - did my buttons get pushed on my last visit.  Our same group of 4 was really looking forward to another amazing experience....I'm pretty sure I ruined that.  

I'm a vegetarian of over 20 years.  Menus and restaurant choices have come a long way since then, which allows me to find something to eat other than a salad when I go out.  Back to Fix.  We all ordered the same items....Kobe burgers, tomato soup, and adult mac and cheese sticks.  Here's where things went bad.....

I get through half of a mac and cheese stick and feel something funny in my mouth.  Something not mac-y and not cheese-y.  I pull it out of my mouth and see - gasp - MEAT!  WHAT!?!??!!  Fiance confirmed.  It's MEAT.  

When the waitress came over, I asked her if there was bacon in the mac and cheese sticks.  She says "No, it's prosciutto, why?  You don't eat pork?"  I told her NO, I'm a VEGETARIAN, and the menu did not list pork as an ingredient and you did not tell me when I ordered that pork is an ingredient.  I had to pull out the piece of pork from my MOUTH before I realized it was an ingredient.  She replies with an "I know, they really should list it on the menu."  And she walks away.  

Hello!??!?!?!  I was polite about it but firmly expressed that I was not happy.  No offer to get my something else, no offer to comp them, nothing.  I would have at least liked some effin' donuts.  Geez.

I just couldn't believe the any upscale restaurant in this day and age would have the audacity to not list an ingredient like MEAT.  It's so frustrating. 

Okay, I'm climbing off the soapbox now.  Good night.

We were very disappointed with our dinner here.  The meat we had was either dry or tough and portions were tiny.  We expected better, being at the Bellagio.  But I guess we got what we paid for at this "lower end" price range.  Let's not forget everything is ala carte.  Pork Prime Rib - tender but bland and dry, filet steak - tough, duck and waffles - bland.  It's location is OK, away from the smoky casino, but it's still a little noisy being open to the pedestrian mall.  You can definitely find something better, especially for the price ($40-$75 per entree).

Good Times!! i meet up here with couple of friends for few drinks. Decor is very chic but so is everything at the Bellagio! the Drinks were on point and so is the bar Tender (pretty Cute) more on the expensive side but definitely not cheap around pouring more liquor in for you and letting you have a good time. Overall it was a great experience even though i didnt taste their food the bar was good enough for me . Did i already mention the drinks were on point!! :-P

SOOOO not worth it!  I was so annoyed because we were forced to eat somewhere fast and in the Bellagio in order to make our "O" showtime.  The menu items were so overpriced and completely disappointing.   I ordered a side of the "very adult fried mac and cheese" and was surprised to bite into a bacon filled mess!  Their menu really should illustrate that this has meat in it for those vegetarians who expect just mac and cheese (as advertised).  

Then when I sent it back, the waitress gave me major attitude.  What happened to good customer service?  Oh yeah it's Vegas, money talks if you want anything around here.

Great restaurant and prices are not too bad either.  Gotta have the fried mac n cheese and chilli cheese fries!  Sliders were pretty good too.  Things you can skip, poke.  Things to know...the bathroom sink has a pretty strong current.  Turn it on slowly so you don't get wet!

I frequent this spot more regularly than other high end casino restaurants/bars. Fix is in a few words...extremely trendy. 

The bar mixes some great drinks and gives Fix the edge over the other steak houses. What stands out is probably their martini's. My girlfriends favorite is the cucumber martini as it stands out from the other specialty drinks on their menu.  Personally, I am a simple person and a Jack & Coke will do me just fine. 

Menu is similar in format to the other steak houses, otherwise. The steaks themselves is nothing to play pomps & circumstance to but is very appetizing. There is this loaded potato bread that is just insane and I hope it is still on the menu next time I go. 

If you are there to see O then this is a great place to grab dinner before the show and possibly grab drinks after the early show. Be careful though...it is within eye shot of Harry Winston! Haha...just keep holding your girlfriends hand and you walk by. It is after all economical.

Stopped by FIX's bar last Wednesday after throughly enjoying the Picasso Printmaking Exhibit.  Sat at the largely empty bar at 6pm- there were only 2 other patrons- both business men. I got terrible service- couldn't get a menu, couldn't catch the bartender's eye to order or pay.  Had to ask the bar back. 

The bartender spent her time with her chest all but out on the bar, chatting with the 2 other customers.  She walked by me at least 25 times, never checking in on me. Vegas is a tough place to have the guts to eat alone at a chi chi bar.  I'll stick to Sushi Samba, Ku Noodle, Giada's, DB Brasserie, Carson kitchen, & China Poblano where I had an excellent time dining alone for lunch, dinner & happy hour throughout the few days I was solo in Vegas

Probably the best meal we had in Vegas over the last six days. apps were great and the  entrees were fantastic.  I had the petite filet mignon and stuffed lobster - unbelievable.  

The prices are high but, coming from NY, nothing we weren't expecting (this is Vegas). The noise level is definitely high - this is not the place to come for a quiet romantic dinner. However, we could easily hear each other and the ambiance was that of a high energy location. 

After reading a few other reviews we requested and were seated at "Edwardo's" section.  He was an excellent waiter, explaining everything on the menu and giving us suggestions after asking our preferences. The service was exemplary for such a crowded location. 

We went on a Monday evening and were glad we made reservations - they were very busy and a number of people who must have just stopped in could not be accommodated. 

Although we saw one or two people in shorts the vast majority were dressed a bit more upscale - let's say "resort casual".

We typically dine at the higher end restaurants - Prime, Olives, Seablue - and were not disappointed by this one.

We ended up at Fix (Bellagio) by sheer chance (nobody else would let us in because Mike was wearing shorts, and he has ugly legs),   The meal was incredible and having Turly on the list didn't hurt either.  The best thing (though the food was excellent) was our two wonderful servers, outstanding.  If the food wasn't great I'd still go there again for the incredible service.

Came here with two other couples for our last dinner in Vegas. We did the $40 for 3 course dinner special and all loved our food. Great service and great atmosphere. I also had a cucumber martini which was very refreshing! Here was what I had to eat...

Appetizer- Mini grilled cheese and tomato bisque (with a pesto garnish)
Entree- Roasted chicken with mashed potatoes
Dessert- Frozen cappuccino with a warm layered chocolate brownie on the side.

See my picture uploads for these courses.
I love stopping in at the bar at Fix whenever I go to the Bellagio to play. Heather, Cisco, Mindy, Liz and Julio are always welcoming and really good at what they do.

We ate here over the weekend, mostly because we couldn't get into the other restaurants in the Bellagio until nearly 10pm.  We had 715 reservations and were seated at 8pm.  The decor is beautiful and the people watching fun (it's Vegas afterall).  Our cocktails were well made and the servers, Mike and Sean, very attentive and helpful.  We started with kobe cheese fries (a build it yourself situation, but yummy).  My friends shared a white fish they loved.  My husband had the filet mignon.  It had a great flavor but was very dry (ordered medium rare) and a little tough.  I had dover sole and this is why my review is rated downward.  I love dover sole and don't get it very often.  At $62 a serving you would think it would be amazing.  Yet, it came out overcook, oversalted, and undersized.  A disappointment all around.  My recommendation would be to be more prepared than we were and get a reservation somewhere else.

FIX is your typical trendy bar/dinner hang out serving up excellent "rich food". It's nothing that will blow your mind but its a great place to hang out and eat the wonders of Kobe Beef, Kobe Pork, and Sea Food. The portions here are pretty small but I have to say the food is really rich, the only saver for such places. Keep that in mind though because the lobster tail looks like an over sized prawn, its not big at all. 

The atmosphere here is pretty nice. Waitresses are looking good, food presentation is good, and the decor is dim, dark, and simplistic.

Overall a great choice to grab a bite and have a drink.

Don't miss the Kale Salad. Nice balance of anchovies and lemon. Pork Shank was the crispest and tender, Lobster Tacos were delicate and perfect with all the plates. I'd come back just for the Tuna on Rice cakes. FIX showed off with celebrating Dad 'a 81st Bday with their addicting donuts to end the night.

Rating: 3.5
We decided to get a bunch of small plates to share. We went with the soft shell crabs (special of the day), crispy rock shrimp, lobster tacos, BLT wedge salad, yellowtail sashimi and spring rolls. Everything I tasted was great but I do wish the tacos were larger (they were the size of my pinky finger). The desserts were mind blowing.

Overall, I enjoyed the vibe and food but felt it was overpriced even for Las Vegas standards. I will return for dessert at the very least.

Enjoyed a couple of drinks and a light meal here last night. The only complaint I can make is the top piece of the bun on my sliders was way too dry. I understand everyone has their own preferences, but for me, the top bun was too thick and dry for my liking. On the flip side, the cocktails were delish, and the truffle fries are a must!

Had a late dinner at Fix this past Saturday night...here are my thoughts:

Ambiance is great. Loved the fact that we could sit "outside" and have a fantastic view of the Bellagio casino.

Service was also great. Our server was friendly and helpful with suggestions.

Food is where Fix loses some points:

-- Lobster tacos are divine but 4 tiny tacos for $24? Absurd.
-- Margarita flat bread was fine, nothing to write home about. And again not worth the price.
-- Baked potato was good but $12? Really? I'm not a grocery expert but if I had to hazard a guess I'd say I could probably buy 15 pounds of ORGANIC potatoes for $12.
-- Roasted veggies were a delicious side but once again not worth the price.

I have no problem overpaying for food in a place like Vegas - it comes with the territory. But Fix takes it to a whole new level with their tiny portions and unreasonable prices.

I won't be back.

Wow! Best calamari We have ever had! Patron Margaritas superb! We had the porterhouse steak special! The peppercorn sauce was amazing! Ate nothing but protein! Marques was the most amazing server ever! Not kidding! We will be eating here again on Sunday when our friends arrive! Do not miss this restaurant when you are in Vegas!

Great food - but not enough and VERY expensive. 3 scallops - $38. better off getting a cheaper meal elsewhere and spending the cash you save on the tables. server was visibly annoyed when we asked to split the bill. cheer up mate, your tip was decent
We sat at the bar for appetizers and cocktails. Everything was amazing!!! Sliders, scallop benedict, yes!!!

With all the choices at Bellagio of great food including one of my favorite restaurants Yellowtail, this place still always surprises me. 

They always come with some different yet amazingly delicious dishes. One which I had a month ago was the Duck With eggs and waffles. This was just heaven in my mouth, every worked so well together and they an aged Maple syrup that was terrific.  Now recently I had the Crispy skin pork shank with sweet corn‍ spoon bread, creamed collards greens, Southern mustard bbq sauce. This dish was amazing they way the pork had crispy skin and just went so with all the sides. 

Definitely recommend this spot.

My experience was ok, though not fantastic. Service was attentive and helpful.

I started with the tomato soup with grill goat cheese sandwich. I pretty much only ordered it for the goat cheese. But the soup was fantastic too. Probably one of the most satisfying bowls of soup I've had. 

I then ordered a filet mignon (medium rare) with mashed potatoes and the adult mac and cheese- I was feeling nostalgic.

The steak was perfect. Cooked the way I like it, tender and juicy and flavorful. The potatoes were good, though nothing special.

Then came the mac&cheese. I wanted to like it. I was more than disappointed. They came as fried macaroni noodles in stick form with a truffle cheese dip on the side. The noodles were overly greasy and the cheese sauce didn't live up to the hype.

Definitely a waste for me since I was eating alone. If I had been sharing with a friend I might have been less disappointed. 

The price overall was fine for a restaurant on the strip. I would definitely try it out again, but probably not until I've had a go at a few other places first.
Good service, nice atmosphere (music is too loud), and food is good (but everything was super salty)....maybe an off night when i visited.

Really?  Really?

Two stars for the hours...and the location and for the bite size portions tasting good during the one bite you have.

The value is non-existent.

Yes, it's Vegas, but I don't believe I will push my luck in finding a meal I can walk away from happily here.

Our waiter......Irvin, was an exceptional class act!    

We arrived without reservations to just have a drink with a relative who was dining there.   We had our drinks and decided to order some appetizers.   
They had to leave for a show, but we stayed in their place and ordered more food and drink.         Topped it all off with the doughnuts!!!!!!!!!!

Everything was excellent.   Will definitely go back our next visit!

Great place for celebrity watching as well.

First time here - won't be our last!  Everything was great - from the service to the food.  Even though a wait was assigned to our table, EVERYONE takes care of you!  We started with the deep fried calamari which came with 2 sauces - a sweet/hot thai chili sauce and a remoulade sauce - great way to start our meal.  The steaks are huge - my husband and I split a steak with a side of smoked cheddar mashed potatoes and added on lobster thermador.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the mashed potates had just the right amount of "smoke" without being overwhelming.  We finished our meal off with a dessert of house-made sugar donuts that had apple pie filling and came with rum raisin and cinnamon apple sauce dips.  So yummy!  The whole time, the waitstaff was so attentive to our needs - never had an empty water glass or a lingering dish.  Great place!

Really enjoyed our dinner here with my wife. Is it pricey, ya... But that shouldn't come as a surprise. I had the seabass which was GREAT. Wife had the filet which was good. We got two sides fried Mac and cheese and cream spinach(probably should have only gotten one since we were both stuffed) but both were great so not sure which I would have chosen if I could only choose one! The place they really get you is on liquor. Two drinks was $26 so drink before you go in!

My mom and I went to Fix @ Bellagio with high hopes prior to seeing "O". Sadly, the food and drinks are mediocre and insanely overpriced, and the menu descriptions are ridiculously inaccurate. Take your money and go over to The Cosmo restaurants where you at least get what you pay for. 

First, I ordered the red sangria which tasted like it had a foot marinating in it. I don't know what red wine they used, but it was nasty. I sent it back and ordered a champagne cocktail which was just ok, and certainly not worth the $20 price tag. I'm not sure I've ever paid that much for a drink, even in the SF Bay Area where I live. 

Second, we ordered the fried mozzarella -- I'm expecting something along the lines of fancy fried cheese sticks, but what came out was a big ball of mozzarella wrapped in phyllo dough sitting in tomato sauce. That was fine, but the strange thing was there was no bread/crostini/etc to put the cheese on. Do they expect people to shovel hunks of straight up melted mozzarella into their mouths? It was just weird. I asked for bread so we had something to put the cheese on, and they delivered dinner rolls. Again, weird, but I suppose it's better than eating straight melted cheese by itself. 

Third, we ordered the adult Mac and cheese. Nowhere does the description on the menu say it's fried, and out comes fried macaroni and cheese "sticks." They were ok (and honestly reminded me of something off a kids menu, which is ironic given their name), but I wasn't intending to order two fried dishes which was annoying. I'm also wondering who the heck wrote the menu and why they don't just give accurate descriptions of the food they're serving. 

Finally, we have the Kobe chili cheese fries. We get a stack of something that's supposed to be fries and a little pot of chili. It was boring. We were sad. At this point we gave up and stopped ordering.

I regret that I spent $112 after tip for a meal that was not any better than one I could have gotten at TGI Friday's.
Had the 14oz New York sirloin.  It was fantastic.  Food, service, and atmosphere were great.  Only thing i didnt like was the creme brulee.
Great atmosphere.   Great steak,  but I would expect nothing less from bellagio.  Well worth the money for a treat but can't afford it all the time.

FIX is an upscale resturant inside Bellagio. Every time I come to Vegas FIX is on my literary :). My favorite is steak and lobster. The lobster is great and the steak is no bad. The stuffing is delicious and the presentation is excellent. They also have great drinks and good wine selection.

I will not return to Fix!  ...and you shouldn't either!

We were staying next door at Aria for opening weekend and decided to try FIX next door at Bellagio. 

We decided to take our time, ordering a couple appetizers at a time until we decided on the entrees while having our drinks.  The sliders were ok, the calamari: decent... it wasn't until we received our lobster tacos that we realized we had chosen the wrong restaurant.  

$22 for 4 extremely tiny mini lobster tacos!  Almost no lobster and the worst part was they were ice cold, as if they had been pulled out of the refrigerator and served!  The piece of cilantro on top was bigger than the entire taco shell!

The waiter kept asking us if we wanted to order a bottle of wine... we were having drinks from the bar and weren't interested.  Then we noticed the only tables getting good service were the ones with wine! We couldn't even remember which waiter was ours since we only saw him maybe once or twice!  We were ready to order entrees but never had a chance because  all the waiters in the restaurant were hanging around the hostess stand. 
A large table of 6 seated nearby left after their appetizers because of the terrible service, and the waiters did nothing to try to stop them... they literally stood up and walked out! I don't even think they ended up paying!

Now we know why the restaurant was almost empty on a night that should've been full!  Not to mention, the bathroom was not clean... considering they have a bathroom attendant right outside the door!  

*btw, if you're looking for some GOOD lobster tacos, try Blue Martini in Towne Square!  They actually use the entire lobster tail in one piece in a large flour tortilla they way it should be! And if you go during happy hour, they're half price!

Received a message from the general manager that I was sent a private message to discuss the poor experience I had. NO MESSAGE. Not a surprise the service is extremely sub-par. This falls in line with my entire experience at FIX.
Some of the best sliders I've eaten, Kobe I believe.

This is definitely a place to eat while in town. Went in for dinner on a Saturday night right before a Cirque du Soleil show, so the location was very convenient for us. Called ahead and made reservations but still had to wait 15 minutes. The atmosphere is more like a lounge rather than a restaurant and it can get pretty loud in there. Personally, I loved the music they were playing. There are crowds of all ages. 

The food is delicious. However, you are definitely paying a good amount for each plate. The portions are rather small but of quality. The lobster tacos are an absolute must. The Kobe beef chili cheese fries is great (does not taste or look like your average chili cheese fries). The scallop appetizer dish is very fresh. This plate includes the greatest bacon I have ever tried! 

I can see myself returning here. 

P.S. They have freshly baked banana filled donuts covered in sugar with two different dipping sauces (peanut butter & chocolate hazelnut) that's out of this world!

Hands down one of the sexies eateries I have been to in quite sometime.  Out of all the restuarants we hit up during my friend's Bachelorette Weekend Bash, FIX was the biggest hit.  If you hit up Kristen of the Light Group she can hook you and your Bachelorette crew up with an awesome special.  $55/pp will get you a tons of yummy apps like salmon/cavier served on a spoon, Kobe sliders with fries/ Jalapeno Yellowtail Sashimi, a refreshing salad and more then you get a choice of an entree.  Our optiions were Roasted Chicken with crispy skit, Sea Bass and I ordered the Pumpkin Raviolis in a sage and butter sauce.  Desert inculded banana stuffed donuts served with a lite chocolate and peanut butter sauce.  So scrumptious.   Good wine list and the Cucumber Martinis are to die for.

When I went to Vegas a few years back, I ate here at the Bellagio before I went to Cirque du Soleil's "O"... and O...M...G...

Very cool ambience inside. The wooden sculptured ceiling is really neat! When I came here I had the Scallop dish. It's served as a scallop "benedict" which is seared scallops with applewood bacon and crab hollandaise. SO DELICIOUS!

It was the great "prefunk" of sorts before our Cirque show! Whenever I am in Vegas again I would definitely come back!

I am so surprised to see that this place has an average rating of 4 stars..i thought the atmosphere was terrible, the menu was overpriced, and the service is better at the DMV. I dont understand how some of these girls in vegas get these waitressing jobs and make a boat load of tips, yet be so stupid! We saw our waitress 3 times, once to take our drink order, once to take our food order, and then to drop off the check. 

Take your business elsewhere
Good food at a good hotel with great service and drinks. Top 5 favorite restaurants on the strip.

I arranged to have my company's Holiday dinner at FIX.  What a big mistake it was.  We had a big group of over 30 people, they arranged to have us sit in round tables joined together, some had 4 people, others had 5 or 6 people.  While the food was sub-par at best, the service was the worst I have ever experienced.   It started during appetizer when each plate had 4 pieces of flat bread.  The servers didn't bother to make sure that tables with 5 or 6 people had enough for everyone, so I had to flag them down to ask.  When the main course was served, the steak came before the steak sauce, and some tables were missing steak sauce.  As the host, I was expecting the waiters and waitresses to take care of making sure my guests were well taken care of.  Instead, I had to run from table to table to make sure everyone had enough sauce. Needless to say, this wasn't the only problem.  The side dishes (mashed potatoes and cream spinach) were so small I manage to get 1 teaspoon of it, and there was hardly enough for my table of 4.  I had to complain, and the waitress brought out 1 extra side for my entire party.  The same thing happened at dessert.  Some tables got their "doughnut" desserts, other's did not.  I had to run around again, bringing extra desserts from one table to another.   After complaining to the waitress that I want to speak to the manager, it took an employee of mine to finally get the Assistant General Manager to come over to talk to me.  

In any decent restaurant, my experience would have resulted in a discount, a reduction in service fees, or at least some sort of compensation to make up for the bad service, but all I heard from him was he was "sorry".  

I will never host another group event at any of the MGM properties or restaurant again because of this bad experiences.  FIX needs some serious fixing.  The manager should be fired for the inability to supervise, and the servers need much more training. The food is over priced, and for the $600+ in gratuities they charged me (compulsory for large groups), I was expecting far better service than this.

The atmosphere was horrible.  You can smell cigarette smoke coming in from the casino, and the sound was so LOUD I couldn't hear anything the person sitting across from me was saying without them having to shout.

AVOID THIS RESTAURANT FOR LARGE GROUPS!

Great place to get a late snack.  The lobster tacos and deep fried mac & cheese are winners.  Take some time to admire the roof of this place.  It's actually very interestingly built if you take the time to look.  I forget the details but one of the workers told me a "story" of how it was put together.  Perfect place to people watch if you get the outer seating.

My boyfriend surprised me with a Valentine's Day reservation at Fix and I was thrilled because I saw so many great reviews about this restaurant. We were a few minutes late to our reservation and they still seated us immediately and were incredibly nice about the whole thing. As soon as we sat down the hostess was so nice and made some small talk and jokes with us which we appreciated, we love people with a good sense of humor. Then our waiter approached us with an incredibly friendly smile. His name was Devon and he told us right off the bat that it would be him and 2 other guys serving us tonight. So we had some questions about drinks and I had seen on yelp to get the raspberry sin and he was honest with me that it was a really sweet drink, but I still wanted to try it. So he brings out the martini glass that has a heap of cotton candy in it and waited so I could record the whole process of him pouring the drink in to make the concoction, so nice of him to do that. For our appetizer we ordered the lobster tacos and calamari. Both were simply amazing. We mainly had Devon asking how everything was going and explaining our meals but there was one other guy helping us who was also so helpful and nice. For the main dish I ordered the filet mignon and my boyfriend ordered the pork chop wrapped in bacon. Absolutely phenomenal. Everything was cooked perfectly. So we joked and talked with our waiters some more and they made the whole experience very comfortable and enjoyable. For dessert we ordered the donuts and they ended up being Apple donuts with 2 different sauces. Best desert ever. I highly recommend the donuts! We even asked them where a good oyster bar was and they gave us a ton of really great recommendations. Overall, we had an amazing Valentine's Day dinner because of the amazing service at Fix and the food, of course.

A girlfriend and I had dinner reservations at Fix. We get there and were seated almost immediately. Very precise on timing. 
Our waiter was very helpful if we had any questions and was attentive just enough where we didn't feel hovered. Great, professional staff. Also, I believe it was the manager or owner that had walked out and checked on all the tables to make everyone was satisfied. I love it when a manager does that, just shows good customer service.

Food deserved 10 stars! We're two girls and we ordered (to split, not each): 
Spice tuna- on crispy rice (melts in your mouth)
8 oz. filet mignon
And for the surf- Jumbo Shrimp Scampi
Very adult Mac & Cheese
I couldn't be happier with the food. Everything was cooked to perfection with lots of flavor making you want more! Total came out to be $70 a person including 20% tip. (We didn't have any drinks). I believe every penny was well over worth it. It was my second time there and I will be back. 

Classy ambiance, dress to impress (this is Bellagio after all)

I had high hopes but our meal here was just ok.  The adult mac and cheese is just way to rich and the texture of the mac and cheese gets lost.  The scallops we had were sandy.  Hard to imagine $40 scallops being gritty but they were.  If we weren't running late for a show I would have returned them.  Filet mignon was very good as was the lobster tacos.  The doughnuts we had for dessert were undercooked on the inside and a bit doughy.  I am sure it is hard to get them just right with the filling but they were a big disappointment.  There are so many great places to eat in Vegas.  We won't be going here again.  ps. but  the wait staff was great.

In a word, DISGUSTING.

Service was minimal.  Food was just terrible.  I had the buffalo chicken "wings"

I should have known something was wrong when they had quotations around the "wings."  It was just odd.  It literally made me sick to my stomach.  And I had to pay $16 for them on top of it. 

Jenn ordered the lobster tacos.  They were so small, you could eat them with a tweezer.  No joke..lol

$100 bucks for disgusting drinks and food?  

Jenn, I told you I wanted Grand Lux Cafe!!!!!

I will never be back.
Good atmosphere but bad food and service. The $60 Steak I ordered was burned and we had to wait another 30 minutes for a second one. The waiter never apologized for the inconvenience.

Best restaurant my girlfriend and I ate at during our week long vacation in Vegas. We celebrated our anniversary here and they took every opportunity to congratulate us. I made reservations ahead on OpenTable, but it wasn't necessary since the restaurant wasn't too crowded when we arrived on Monday night. Upon arrival, we were promptly seated and greeted by Tom. He was very insightful and knew the menu like the back of his hand. He recommended to us his favorite items, which is always appreciated. We started off with the Adult Mac and Cheese, which to my surprise, doesn't come as a typical Mac n Cheese dish. They dish was fried like chicken fingers and there was a cheese sauce that accompanied it. It was a bit heavy being fried and dipped in cheese, but that's what I was expecting. For our entree, we ordered the SeaBass Risotto w/ lobster broth and Scallops benedict with potato cake. Let me just say, WOW. Both dishes were superb. The risotto was soft, creamy, and savory. The seabass was cooked to perfection with a crispy skin on top. The fish wasn't overcooked or chewy and was very fragile. The scallops was cooked nicely with a crisp on one side. It wasn't bitter, but flavorful with soft scallop meat. It was drizzled with crab hollandaise sauce. It didn't taste like breakfast, but a hearty dinner. To finish off the night, we were given complimentary champagne while eating Tiramisu Trifle. The trifle wasn't too sweet and had just the right amount of cream and lady fingers. The cup was big like a Sunday, but manageable. Throughout the whole night, there were three waiters who consistently check on us to ask how the dinner was. The bill came out to be around $150, which is pricey but is warranted by the location in the Bellagio and great service. This place is truly a gem and is underrated since there are so many other restaurants here.

Meh, what a disappointment.  The place was packed and the menu looked promising, so I was looking forward to our meal.
The best thing about the first two courses of dinner was the wine I ordered.  The mixed green salad was rumored to come with candied nuts and pears.  Two flaccid nuts and a one inch stack of matchstick pear slices did not lend much flavor to the dish.  $16?  For a pile of mediocre spring mix?  The pizza was pretty good, but small and not substantial for the price, and my lovely dining companion really enjoyed her salad (the BLT wedge).
The service was okay - it seems that 10 tables of mostly two tops for two waitresses is overwhelming though as we were fairly forgotten off in our corner, oh, you know, directly next to the computer where they spent most of their time.  
Had we not ordered dessert this place would've gotten two incredibly overpriced stars from me.  
Lucky for them the banana bread pudding was quite possibly the most delicious pile of soggy bread I've ever had.

Unfortunately, I didn't get my FIX.

I am in the middle for this place. The service was great, they were very hospitable and just attentive without being intrusive. To conduct such service in an environment, where everyone is either drunk or not from there ... is impressive. I wouldn't recommend this place for big groups. When my friend had made the reservation for us, and they said the limit was 5 -- that seemed to make sense. The environment is intimate, cozy and there is a lot of noise.

The place itself is nice, I love the decor... it's warm woods, make it sexy and the way that it opens up into the hotel is nice. It doesn't close you off from the hustle and bustle that is the Bellagio... and ultimately, that is Vegas.

Where I run into trouble is the actual menu itself. It's kind of boring. The food, I feel is art here. But more like paint running down a wall. I was uninspired and slightly sober... so I still hold true to that. And that is the point of Vegas, if you eat more than you drink... something is to be said. So ultimately, you don't get your fix.

There was a wide array at the table. Lobster tacos were $22, and came into very small finger size tacos served on a metal rack. Pizza was tapas size which ran $18. Kobe Sliders with Fries runs $25. Filet runs $50 with no sides. For myself, I ordered like an anorexic -- because I had just swallowed a buffet earlier in the day. I did the Fried Mac n' Cheese which was delectable and the Cucumber Essence martini was great. Total of that $24. And in true Vegas fashion, somehow $60 escaped me at this place.

All in all, I might come back. If I can let go of my inner fat girl and not surrender to my natural gluttony. Because, when I sit down to eat... I don't expect to feel helpless looking at the food coming out... I expect to feel slightly satisfied.

adult mac-n-cheese was my favorite thing at FIX. 

athough i ordered a brazed short ribs, steak, lobster mashed potatoes, and baby cheeseburgers all on different occasions. all things i would get again and recommend to friends!

never made it to the full menu at FIX during the dinner time mostly got some snacks before the club when they had a smaller menu.

staff here is so-so

i don't have much to add that hasn't been said before!  between two of us, we had popcorn at the O performance as our appetizer, then appetizers at FIX as our dinner.  the spicy tuna on rice cakes was fantastic, although a little annoying to serve two people five pieces.  then again, we got three burgers, so perhaps we were supposed to compromise on who got the extra burger vs th extra ahi.  we were more diplomatic and split both, but cutting a tiny sushi bite in half after drinking champagne is quite the exercise in motor skills.  i think there were an even number of mac n cheese sticks... i could've eaten a whole second order quite easily.  dipping the fries in the sauces that came with the sticks was also lovely.  yum.  plus, the two of us had plenty of food for a price reasonable enough to allow for gelato at the cafe (or crepes at jean-philippe) for dessert.

Very hipster place. My bf's family was in town visiting and they wanted something to eat in the Bellagio where they were staying, so FIX it was.  Expensive and honestly, not a whole lot of options if you're somewhat of a picky eater. I'm not saying I only like burgers, pizza, etc....I like a variety of foods, but I just could not see paying $36 for a chicken dish that would probably leave me feeling hungry still.  I am not a seafood eater so I found eating sides and starters would be the way to go. Flatbread, his sister and mom split it....$15 and there were 4 small squares let's say 2"x 2". I'm not kidding. I had very adult mac & cheese (per what the menu read) which had prosciutto, mac and cheese breaded and deep fried (think mozzarella stick), and served with a 3 cheese sauce w/ truffle oil. It was delicious, but not for $12/$14 whatever it was. I got 5 sticks I think. THAT was my dinner. Thankfully the BLT wedge salad is literally an entire head of iceberg lettuce chopped in half that my BF willingly split with me. Otherwise, I would have been starving.

Ate here again and the chicken, pork chop and ribeye should be added to the list for good entrees.  Had the yellowtail sashimi appetizer and the fish was good quality, but nothing really special there.  Really fun place to eat.  One of the highlights of a great Memorial Day weekend.

Love their show package. You can get it with the "O" show.
I didn't expect much since it was a package deal, but the steak was really really fabulous! As was the salad & the dessert!

The girlfriend and I were looking for some post-Absinthe dinner as we were walking through the Bellagio.  After reviewing our options, we decided on Fix since the place was largely empty at 9:45pm on at Tuesday night and getting a seat at the bar was not a problem.  Just off of the gaming floor, Fix is a chic, modern-looking restaurant/bar with a distinctive wavy wood interior serving upscale American comfort food.

The cocktail list was, sadly, a cliché martini list (really, it is the 21st Century) lacking any drinks utilizing brown spirits.  I started off with the Cucumber Martini ($20) made with Square One Cucumber Vodka, white cranberry juice, and garnished with fresh cucumber and cherry tomatoes.  The drink was nicely balanced with pleasant cucumber aromatics.  It was very pricey (tied with the Bellagio's Lily Bar for the most expensive drinks that I've ever had in Vegas) and, while reasonably enjoyable, not a good value.  

The gf and I split orders of Kobe Chili Cheese Fries ($17), Very Adult Mac & Cheese ($12), and Beef Carpaccio ($21).  The beef carpaccio was a traditional preparation and presentation.  It was well executed and nicely accented by the drizzling of truffle vinaigrette over the thinly sliced beef.  The chili cheese fries and mac & cheese were far less traditional in preparation and presentation, but no less successful or enjoyable.  The chili cheese fries were a deconstructed/"build your own" representation of the classic comfort food staple.  The kobe chili was mildly spicy with a hint of sweetness, and delicious.  The fries were hot, steamy, and crispy.  The cheddar cheese sauce was far from Velveeta.  DC's renowned/way overrated Ben's Chili Bowl could learn a thing or twenty from Fix about chili cheese fries.  The Very Adult Mac & Cheese was presented as three flavorful bars of perfectly deep-fried, four-cheese mac & cheese infused with prosciutto and drizzled with truffle oil.  While it may have been a "very adult" mac & cheese, there was nothing my inner child didn't enjoy about the dish.  

Fix may not be the best or most acclaimed restaurant on the Strip, but it does what it does, pretty well.  The food, while not inexpensive, is a much better value than the drinks.  Call it 4 stars for the food and 2 stars for the cocktails.

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! I've had everything on the menu and there isn't a single thing that I don't like. I usually come here with friends and we order a bunch of appetizers and dishes so that we can share and taste a little bit of everything.

Must trys are: Lobster Tacos, Bobby Baldwin Burgers, Spicy Tuna, Adult Mac N Cheese, BLT Crab Cakes. All of their food sounds like stuff you've heard of or tried before but they add twists to their dishes that takes it to another level that you've never tasted.

The restaurant doesn't have a fourth wall (besides a hip level wall/divider) so it basically opens into the casino... which makes for great people watching if you sit on the outskirts of the restaurant. The feel is hip, trendy, sexy (its Vegas after all) and has a constant beat of ongoing music.

They do take reservations but the bar and lounge is open seating and provides about 10-13 small tables and booths, plus seating at the bar so you can usually find somewhere to squeeze in even during busy times.

Dark and clubby all the time. We stopped in there for a drink on a beautiful sunny day. It was very dark - yes there are no windows and that's the way the place is but they could have raised the lights and made it more lively.

We decided to leave when we saw the bar was packed with people who thought they were at Tryst at 2am.
Went there last night got the lobster tacos and they so small.... Also the size of a half dollar. Service was meh will neve go back

The environment and service are great but the food while good, is not what I expected.    My filet was delicious, but over priced as was all the food at the table.   My friends felt the same about their dinner, so I don't feel I'm being unfair.   We had dinner at Brio Tuscan Grill in  Town Square for less than half the price and the food was far more note worthy (I had filet at Brio as well).
Fix was a fun experience but I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends.

Stayed at the Bellagio over Memorial Day Weekend. Fix was able to accommodate my girlfriend and I on multiple occasions with no waiting. We sat at the bar and had amazing service from Sisco (sorry if the spelling is wrong), Heather, and Shane. Very inviting staff and great menu and cocktail options.

Awesome food and service, everything was very fresh and melted in my mouth including those vodka shots! 

Good times!

We were on our way to the buffet but when we saw the line we decided to eat here instead. We are very glad that we did. The Pork roast was so tender that my mouth is still watering thinking about it as I type this review. Do not miss the "very adult Mac & Cheese" words cant describe how good this was. But other than the food we couldn't believe how nice the people were at this restaurant. Everyone had a genuine conversation with you not just the typical welcome, how are you? I will definitely be back

You can't go wrong with anything on the menu here!!!!! The staff is on top of it! The drinks are impeccable :) the gum drop martini and the cotton candy martini are amazing! The bartenders are great! The chef is the best! Highly HIGHLY recommend!!

this restaurant is an absolute must when in vegas.  the service is consistently excellent, as well as the food and drinks.  this is the one restaurant i visit each and every time i'm in vegas.  be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes if you don't have a reservation.  make sure to order the lobster tacos and blue cheese lettuce wedge.
